title: Nigeria: CTL Flags Off 'One Home One Decoder' Campaign
text:
Cote d'Ivoire: UNEP Côte d'Ivoire Assessment Highlights Action Required for Path to Sustainable Development By Nurudeen Oyewole 
Lagos — Nigerian Cable TV operator, Communications Trends Limited (CTL), has flagged off its 'one home one decoder' campaign which is expected to spread to nine Nigerian cities in the next few days. 
In a statement made available to Daily Trust on Saturday in Lagos, the operator said its campaign which started on the 31st of August in Port Harcourt is aimed at ensuring that every home in Nigeria enjoys the full benefits of owning a CTL multi-channel decoder. 
The statement signed by the Chief Operating Officer (COO) of The Udemba Group, owners of CTL, Mr OfemEkapong also noted that CTL TV services are currently running in nine Nigerian cities,namely Port Harcourt, Abuja, Owerri , Enugu, Umuahia, Uyo, Warri, Benin, Onitsha. 
According to the statement, "The ongoing promo is designed to make CTL decoders available to more homes within these areas of coverage and commence the process of delivering its services nationwide. It is a campaign of 'One Home One Decoder' which is the first step in the corporate mission of putting CTL decoders in at least 20 million homes nationwide by 2018." Nigeria
